title: Every New Scripted Show Confirmed to Premiere in 2025 â€” Save the Dates!

author: Ryan Schwartz
excerpt: TVLine presents a comprehensive list of every new TV show premiering across broadcast, cable and streaming for the remainder of 2025.
text: TVLine presents a chronological list of new TV shows â€” all English-language, scripted series â€” confirmed to premiere across broadcast, cable and streaming in the U.S. in the year 2025. Additional titles and release dates will be added as theyâ€™re announced, so be sure to bookmark this page and check back for frequent updates. Want scoop on any of the following shows? (Episode 2 follows Monday.) WEDNESDAY, MAY 28 ğŸ“º 9 pm Adults (FX, two-episode premiere)A group of twenty-somethings in New York try to be good people, despite being neither â€œgoodâ€ nor â€œpeopleâ€ yet. (All eight episodes drop the following day on Hulu.) Q (Netflix, nine-episode binge)A brash but brilliant detective (Matthew Goode) leads a cold case unit in this Edinburgh-based drama. WEDNESDAY, JUNE 4 ğŸ“º Stick (Apple TV+, three-episode premiere)Owen Wilson plays an ex-pro golfer who hedges his bets â€” and future â€” entirely on a troubled 17-year-old golf phenom. FRIDAY, JUNE 6 ğŸ“º The Survivors (Netflix, six-episode binge)Fifteen years ago, the loss of three young people tore this sleepy seaside town apart. Now, the mysterious death of a young woman dredges up the past. MONDAY, JUNE 9 ğŸ“º Art Detectives (Acorn TV, two-episode premiere)Stephen Moyer plays a detective who solves murders connected to the world of art and antiques â€” from Old Master paintings, to Banksy street art, to medieval manuscripts and collectible vinyl. SUNDAY, JUNE 15 ğŸ“º 8 pm Patience (PBS)A detective (Laura Fraser) takes a neurodivergent woman (Ella Maisy Purvis) under her wing to assist with complex criminal investigations. TUESDAY, JUNE 17 ğŸ“º Hell Motel (Shudder, two-episode premiere)A group of 10 true-crime obsessives (including Eric McCormick) are invited to the site of an unsolved Satanic Mass Murder, where history repeats itself and a murder spree ensues. WEDNESDAY, JUNE 18 ğŸ“º Outrageous (BritBox, two-episode premiere)The six-part drama is inspired by the lives of the aristocratic Mitford sisters â€“ six headstrong women who frequently made headlines around the world. ğŸ“º We Were Liars (Prime Video, eight-episode binge)A teenager (Emily Alyn Lind) and her tight-knit inner circle â€” nicknamed the Liars â€” spend the summer on her grandfatherâ€™s private island. THURSDAY, JUNE 19 ğŸ“º The Waterfront (Netflix, eight-episode binge)Melissa Benoist is featured in this Kevin Williamson drama about a familyâ€™s efforts to retain control of their crumbling fishing empire. TUESDAY, JUNE 24 ğŸ“º 9 pm Ironheart (Disney+, three-episode premiere)Inventor Riri Williams (Dominique Thorne) gets wrapped up with the mysterious and charming Parker Robbins (Anthony Ramos). FRIDAY, JUNE 27 ğŸ“º Smoke (Apple TV+, two-episode premiere)A troubled detective (Jurnee Smollett) and an enigmatic arson investigator (Taron Egerton) pursue the trails of two serial arsonists SUNDAY, JUNE 29 ğŸ“º 9 pm Nautilus (AMC, two-episode premiere)Inspired by the Jules Verne novel â€œTwenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea,â€ Nautilus tells the origin story of the iconic Captain Nemo. TUESDAY, AUG. 12 ğŸ“º 8 pm Alien: Earth (FX)The prequel is set roughly 70 years in the future, and 30 years prior to the events of the original Sigourney Weaver-led film. TUESDAY, SEPT. 23 ğŸ“º 9 pm The Lowdown (FX, two-episode premiere)Ethan Hawke plays a citizen journalist â€” a self-proclaimed Tulsa â€œtruthstorianâ€ whose obsession with the truth is always getting him into trouble.Â  TUESDAY, SEPT. 30 ğŸ“º Chad Powers (Hulu, two-episode premiere)Glen Powell plays a hotshot quarterback who nukes his Division I career, then joins a struggling Southern football team. FRIDAY, OCT. 3 ğŸ“º Marvel Zombies (Disney+)The animated series is spun off of the fifth episode of What Ifâ€¦? ğŸ“º The Abandons (Netflix)A group of diverse, outlier families pursue their Manifest Destiny in 1850s Oregon; Lena Headey, Gillian Anderson and Lucas Till star. ğŸ“º All Her Fault (Peacock)Sarah Snook headlines this missing-child thriller based on the best-selling novel by Andrea Mara. ğŸ“º The Beast in Me (Netflix)An author (Claire Danes) investigates her neighbor (Matthew Rhys), who is a prime suspect in his wifeâ€™s murder. ğŸ“º Black Rabbit (Netflix)The owner of a New York City hotspot (Jude Law) allows his turbulent brother (Jason Bateman) back into his life. ğŸ“º Boston Blue (CBS)The Blue Bloods universe expansion sees Donnie Wahlbergâ€™s Detective Danny Reagan leaving New York City â€” and his family â€” to take a position with the Boston Police Department. ğŸ“º CIA (CBS)The FBI offshoot pairs a fast-talking, rule-breaking, loose cannon CIA case officer (played by Tom Ellis) and a by-the-book, seasoned and smart FBI agent who believes in the rule of law. ğŸ“º The Chair Company (HBO)Tim Robinson plays a man who finds himself investigating a far-reaching conspiracy following an embarrassing incident at work. ğŸ“º Death by Lightning (Netflix)Michael Shannon plays President James Garfield in the stranger-than-fiction story about his greatest admirer (Matthew Macfadyen) â€” the man who would come to kill him. ğŸ“º Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy (Peacock)Michael Chernus plays the titular serial killer. ğŸ“º DMV (CBS)Harriet Dyer leads the single-camera workplace comedy set at the place everyone dreads going most. ğŸ“º Haunted Hotel (Netflix)The Dan Harmon cartoon is about about a single mother who struggles to run a haunted hotel with the help of her estranged, dead brother. ğŸ“º The Institute (MGM+)Mary-Louise Parker and Ben Barnes lead the series adaptation of Stephen Kingâ€™s 2019 novel. ğŸ“º IT: Welcome to Derry (HBO)The prequel brings back Bill SkarsgÃ¥rd to reprise his film role as the terrifying clown Pennywise. ğŸ“º Leanne (Netflix)Comedian Leanne Morgan headlines the Chuck Lorre multi-cam about a woman whose husband of 30+ years leaves her for another woman. ğŸ“º NCIS: Tony & Ziva (Paramount+)When Tonyâ€™s security company is attacked, he and Ziva must go on the run across Europe, try to figure out who is after them, and maybe even learn to trust each other again so they can finally have their unconventional happily ever after. ğŸ“º The Rainmaker (USA Network)The John Grisham novel, previously adapted for the big screen, gets the basic cable treatment. ğŸ“º Robin Hood (MGM+)A modern take to the classic tale of the roguish outlaw hero, and the epic love story between him and a courageous and daring Marian. ğŸ“º The Seven Dials Mystery (Netflix)Helena Bonham Carter and Martin Freeman star in this tale of a practical joke that goes horribly, murderously wrong in 1925 England. ğŸ“º Sheriff Country (CBS)Morena Baccarinâ€™s Sheriff Mickey Fox â€” stepsister of Fire Countryâ€™s Sharon Leone â€” patrols the streets of small-town Edgewater. ğŸ“º Anne Riceâ€™s The Talamasca (AMC)A secret organization is responsible for tracking and containing witches, vampires, werewolves and other creatures scattered around the globe. ğŸ“º Task (HBO)Mark Ruffalo leads an FBI task force that attempts to put an end to a string of drug-house robberies led by an unsuspecting family man. ğŸ“º Untamed (Netflix)A special agent (Eric Bana) for the National Parks Service investigates a brutal death that sends him on a collision course with dark secrets from his past. ğŸ“º Untitled Bosch Spinoff (Prime Video)Maggie Q stars as RenÃ©e Ballard in this offshoot, which is due out following the release of third and final season of Bosch: Legacy. ğŸ“º Untitled Rachel Sennott Comedy (HBO)A co-dependent friend group reunites, navigating how the time apart, ambition and new relationships have changed them. ğŸ“º Wayward (Netflix)Mae Martin and Toni Collette star in a thriller that explores the insidious underbelly of the â€œtroubled teen industry,â€ and the eternal struggle between one generation and the next. ğŸ“º Wonder Man (Disney+)Yahya Abdul-Mateen IIÂ fills the title role â€” aka Simon Williams. PREMIERED SO FAR IN 2025: WEDNESDAY, JAN. 1 ğŸ“º Missing You (Netflix, binge release)A detective (Rosalind Eleazar) gets caught up in a dark conspiracy after unexpectedly encountering an old flame online. THURSDAY, JAN. 2 ğŸ“º Lockerbie: Search the Truth (Peacock, binge release)Colin Firth plays a grieving father whose daughter was killed in the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103. ğŸ“º 9:30 pm Going Dutch (Fox)Denis Leary is an arrogant, loudmouth colonel reassigned to the least important army base in the world. TUESDAY, JAN. 7 ğŸ“º 9 pm Doc (Fox)Molly Parker plays a brilliant doctor who suffers a brain injury and is left with no memories of the last eight years of her life. WEDNESDAY, JAN. 8 ğŸ“º 8 pm Shifting Gears (ABC)Tim Allen is the widowed owner of a classic car restoration shop who is reunited with his estranged daughter (Kat Dennings) and her two kids. THURSDAY, JAN. 9 ğŸ“º American Primeval (Netflix, binge release)Taylor Kitsch and Betty Gilpin headline this dark and gritty retelling of the exploration and birth of the American West in 1857. ğŸ“º On Call (Prime Video, binge release)Troian Bellisario is veteran police officer who takes on a new trainee (Brandon Larracuente) and patrols the streets of Long Beach, Calif. ğŸ“º 9 pm The Pitt (Max, weekly release)Noah Wyle scrubs in for a real-time examination of the challenges facing healthcare workers in a run-down Pittsburgh ER. FRIDAY, JAN. 17 ğŸ“º 9 pm The Couple Next Door (Starz)Sam Heughan is at the center of a complicated relationship between two suburban couples. SUNDAY, JAN. 19 ğŸ“º 7 pm The Hunting Party (NBC)Melissa Roxburgh leads a team of investigators who track down and capture escapees from a top-secret prison. WEDNESDAY, JAN. 22 ğŸ“º Prime Target (Apple TV+, weekly release)Leo Woodall plays a mathematician on the verge of a major breakthrough who discovers that an unseen enemy is trying to destroy his idea. SUNDAY, JAN. 26 ğŸ“º 10 pm Watson (CBS)Morris Chestnutâ€™s Dr. John Watson resumes his medical career six months after Sherlock Holmes dies at the hands of Moriarty. TUESDAY, JAN. 28 ğŸ“º Paradise (Hulu, weekly release)Sterling K. Brown is head of security for a former president residing in a serene, affluent community. WEDNESDAY, JAN. 29 ğŸ“º Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man (Disney+, weekly release)The animated series follows Peter Parker on his way to becoming Spider-Man, promising a journey unlike weâ€™ve ever seen before. THURSDAY, FEB. 6 ğŸ“º Apple Cider Vinegar (Netflix, binge release)Kaitlyn Dever plays a wellness influencer who lies about having brain cancer. ğŸ“º Clean Slate (Prime Video, binge release)An old-school car wash owner (George Wallace) has a lot of soul searching to do when the child he once called â€œsonâ€ returns after 17 years as a proud trans woman (Laverne Cox).Â  ğŸ“º The Z-Suite (Tubi, weekly release)Lauren Graham plays an advertising maven who, along with her right hand executive (Nico Santos), must take down an eager team of Gen-Zers. WEDNESDAY, FEB. 19 ğŸ“º Win or Lose (Disney+, weekly release)The Pixar original features the perspectives of insecure little leaguers, their helicopter parents and a lovesick umpire as they prepare for a big game. ğŸ“º 9 pm Good Cop/Bad Cop (The CW)Leighton Meester and Luke Cook play sibling detectives who work together to solve crimes. THURSDAY, FEB. 20 ğŸ“º Zero Day (Netflix, weekly release)Robert De Niro is a former POTUS tasked with finding the perpetrators of a devastating cyber attack; Angela Bassett plays the sitting president. FRIDAY, FEB. 21 ğŸ“º A Thousand Blows (Hulu, binge release)Peaky Blinders creator Steven Knight presents an epic tale set in the perilous world of illegal boxing in 1880s Victorian London. SUNDAY, FEB. 23 ğŸ“º 9 pm Suits LA (NBC)Stephen Amell plays a former federal prosecutor who has reinvented himself, now representing the most powerful clients in Los Angeles. ğŸ“º 10 pm Grosse Pointe Garden Society (NBC)Melissa Fumero is among the members of a gardening club whose lives are intertwined by scandal, mischief and murder. MONDAY, FEB. 24 ğŸ“º 2 pm Beyond the Gates (CBS)Tamara Tunie and Clifton Davis lead this daytime soap about a powerful and prestigious family that is the very definition of Black royalty. THURSDAY, FEB. 27 ğŸ“º Running Point (Netflix, binge release)Kate Hudson plays the owner of a fictitious, Los Angeles-based basketball team. SUNDAY, MARCH 2 ğŸ“º 9 pm Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue (MGM+)Eric McCormack stars in this mystery about plane crash victims whose bodies are recovered and placed in a morgueâ€¦ but only one of them is actually dead. TUESDAY, MARCH 4 ğŸ“º 9 pm Daredevil: Born Again (Disney+, weekly release)Matt Murdock (Charlie Cox) and Wilson Fisk (Vincent Dâ€™Onofrio) find themselves on an inevitable collision course. THURSDAY, MARCH 6 ğŸ“º Deli Boys (Hulu, binge release)When their convenience store-magnate father suddenly dies, pampered Pakistani American brothers must reckon with his secret life of crime. ğŸ“º Lil Kev (BET+, binge release)Kevin Hart, Wanda Sykes and Deon Cole lend their voices to this adult animated comedy inspired by Hartâ€™s childhood in North Philadelphia. THURSDAY, MARCH 13 ğŸ“º Adolescence (Netflix, binge release)A familyâ€™s world is turned upside down when a teenager is arrested for the murder of a classmate. ğŸ“º Long Bright River (Peacock, binge release)Amanda Seyfried plays a police officer investigating a recent string of murders in a Philadelphia neighborhood hard-hit by the opioid crisis. FRIDAY, MARCH 14 ğŸ“º Dope Thief (Apple TV+, weekly release)Brian Tyree Henry and Wagner Moura play delinquents whose small-time grift morphs into a life-and-death enterprise. WEDNESDAY, MARCH 19 ğŸ“º Good American Family (Hulu, weekly release)Ellen Pompeo and Mark Duplass portray a midwestern couple who adopt a young Ukrainian girl with a rare form of dwarfism â€” or so theyâ€™re led to believe. THURSDAY, MARCH 20 ğŸ“º Happy Face (Paramount+, weekly release)Annaleigh Ashford plays Melissa Moore, who was 15 when she discovered that her father (Dennis Quaid) is a serial killer. ğŸ“º The Residence (Netflix, binge release)Uzo Aduba leads a star-studded, screwball whodunnit from Shondaland, set in the halls of the White House. FRIDAY, MARCH 21 ğŸ“º BE@RBRICK (Apple TV+, binge release)The CG-animated childrenâ€™s show follows Jasmine Finch and her bandmates as they pursue their dreams and inspire others to do the same. FRIDAY, MARCH 28 ğŸ“º Mid-Century Modern (Hulu, binge release)Nathan Lane, Matt Bomer and Nathan Lee Graham play three best friends â€” gay gentlemen of a certain age â€” who decide to spend their golden years living together in Palm Springs. SUNDAY, MARCH 30 ğŸ“º MobLand (Paramount+)Tom Hardy, Pierce Brosnan and Helen Mirren star in a global crime thriller about warring families and a fiercely loyal fixer. THURSDAY, APRIL 3 ğŸ“º The Bondsman (Prime Video, binge release)Kevin Bacon plays a murdered bounty hunter who is resurrected by the Devil to trap and send back demons that have escaped from Hell. ğŸ“º Pulse (Netflix, binge release)Willa Fitzgerald, Colin Woodell and Justina Machado star in this medical procedural set at Miamiâ€™s busiest Level 1 Trauma Center. FRIDAY, APRIL 4 ğŸ“º Dying for Sex (Hulu, binge release)Michelle Williams plays a woman who leaves her husband of 15 years and begins to explore her sexuality after being diagnosed with breast cancer. THURSDAY, APRIL 10 ğŸ“º North of North (Netflix, binge release)A young Inuk woman wants to build a new future for herself after a spontaneous â€” and extremely public â€” exit from her marriage. FRIDAY, APRIL 11 ğŸ“º Your Friends & Neighbors (Apple TV+, weekly release)Jon Hamm plays a disgraced hedge fund manager who resorts to stealing from the homes of his affluent neighbors. WEDNESDAY, APRIL 16 ğŸ“º Government Cheese (Apple TV+, weekly release)David Oyelowo stars in this surrealist, â€™60s-set comedy about a quirky family pursuing lofty (and seemingly impossible) dreams. ğŸ“º 9 pm Sherlock & Daughter (The CW)David Thewlisâ€™ Sherlock Holmes works with a young American woman â€” who may or may not be his daughter â€” to solve a global conspiracy. THURSDAY, APRIL 17 ğŸ“º #1 Happy Family USA (Prime Video, binge release)Ramy Youssefâ€™s animated comedy follows the maniacally upbeat Husseins â€” the most patriotic, most peaceful, and most definitely-not-suspicious Muslim family in post-9/11 â€œAmreeka.â€ ğŸ“º Ransom Canyon (Netflix, binge release)Josh Duhamel and Minka Kelly lead this contemporary western saga that charts the intersecting lives (and loves) of three ranching families. THURSDAY, APRIL 24 ğŸ“º Ã‰toile (Prime Video, binge release)Set in both New York and Paris, the Amy Sherman-Palladino dramedy follows the dancers and artistic staff of two ballet companies as they embark on an ambitious gambit to save their storied institutions. THURSDAY, MAY 1 ğŸ“º The Four Seasons (Netflix, binge release)Six old friends â€” including Tina Fey, Will Forte, Colman Domingo and Steve Carell â€” head for a relaxing weekend away, only to discover that one couple is about to split up. SUNDAY, MAY 4 ğŸ“º Star Wars: Tales of the Underworld (Disney+, six-episode binge)Former assassin and bounty hunter Asajj Ventress is given a new chance at life and must go on the run with an unexpected new ally, while outlaw Cad Bane faces his past when he confronts an old friend, now a Marshal on the opposite side of the law. ğŸ“º 9 pm Miss Austen (PBS)Keeley Hawes and Rose Leslie lead this witty and heartbreaking reimagining of a literary mystery involving sisters Cassandra and Jane. THURSDAY, MAY 8 ğŸ“º Forever (Netflix, eight-episode binge)The Judy Blume adaptation tells the story of two Black teens (played by Lovie Simone and Michael Cooper Jr.) exploring romance and their identities through the awkward journey of being each otherâ€™s firsts. TUESDAY, MAY 13 ğŸ“º Bad Thoughts (Netflix, six-episode binge)The single-camera comedy offers a collection of disturbing stories that push the boundaries of decency in ways only Tom Segura could imagine. THURSDAY, MAY 15 ğŸ“º Bet (Netflix, 10-episode binge)The teen drama is set at a private school where gambling determines social status. ğŸ“º Overcompensating (Prime Video, eight-episode binge)A college-set comedy about a closeted former football player and homecoming king (played by series creator Benito Skinner) as he becomes fast friends with an outsider on a mission to fit in at all costs. ğŸ“º 9 pm Duster (Max, weekly release)Josh Holloway is a gutsy getaway driver for a growing crime syndicate who sees his life go from awful toâ€¦ wildly, stupidly, dangerously awful. FRIDAY, MAY 16 ğŸ“º Murderbot (Apple TV+, two-episode premiere)Based on Martha Wellsâ€™ bestselling book series, the sci-fi thriller-comedy stars Alexander SkarsgÃ¥rd as a self-hacking security construct who is horrified by human emotion yet drawn to its vulnerable clients. TUESDAY, MAY 20 ğŸ“º Motorheads (Prime Video, 10-episode binge)Twin siblings (Michael Cimino and Melissa Collazo) and their mother (Nathalie Kelley) move in with their uncle (Ryan Phillippe), who is haunted by the disappearance of his younger brother.Â  THURSDAY, MAY 22 ğŸ“º Tyler Perryâ€™s She the People (Netflix, eight-episode binge)Lieutenant Governor candidate Antoinette Dunkerson (Terri J. Vaughn) runs a successful campaign and now must figure out how to thrive under a sexist and condescending governor while attempting to keep her family in line now that theyâ€™re all in the public eye. ğŸ“º Sirens (Netflix, five-episode binge)Devon (Meghann Fahy), who thinks her sister Simone (Milly Alcock) has a creepy relationship with her new boss Michaela (Julianne Moore), decides itâ€™s time for an intervention â€” but she has no idea what a formidable opponent Michaela will be. An A-to-Z List of 300+ Scripted Series
